config.comments: In order for InvokeHTTP to work, it needs an existing flowfile. So this is a fake and unless flowfile, but is offsets a known bug.
Identify and assign the ID and Status variables to Nifi Attributes

Any string manipulation Processor could be used here... we are simply using the replacestring one.
This is where the cassandra insert statement is being built
Parse all Jira "issues" into a json FlowFile
Update FlowFile name to include ID and Status, so it's easier to see which FlowFile relates to which Jira Issues. This helps with debugging and troubleshooting.
Create the startat attribute and start at 0
Define a set of true/false variables to determine how many pagination FlowFiles need to be created based on the 'total' Attribute.

Increase startat by 100 and decrease total by 100, this gets feed back into the previous step and continues until total is less than 100. The number 100 is used because that is the maxResults defined in the Jira API
Call the webservice API. Right now we are pulling the first 50 issues, but really only storing the "Total" so we can loop through each page of subsequent issues.

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

config.comments: Paginate through all FlowFiles returning all Jira issues
